%text The \underline\text{ concept} of conditional probability answers the following question
\textit{What is the probability of an event A} \textit{happening \underline\text{ given that} event B already has?}
Thomas Bayes was the first to provide the following \underline\text{mathematical} formula for evaluating conditional probabilities.
\[ P\left( A\vert B\right) = \dfrac{P(A\cap B)}{P(B)} = \dfrac{P(B\vert A)\cdot P(A)}{P(B)} \] %
